definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: They  fired at a fleeting enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他们向正在逃跑的敌人开火。

sentences.english: Airframe shake for all aircraft when cannon is fired.
sentences.chinese: 所有飞机在机炮开火时，机身会抖动。

sentences.english: Who first fired on the American-Afghan force?
sentences.chinese: 是谁首先向驻阿富汗的美国部队开火？

sentences.english: The guns belched at the enemy.
Bakiyev has denied ordering troops to fire on protesters.
sentences.chinese: 巴基耶夫已否认命令军队向示威者开火。

sentences.english: A gun with a silencer fires once.
sentences.chinese: 一把带着消音器的枪立即开火了。

sentences.english: The trapped men shot out through the windows at their attackers.
sentences.chinese: 那些被围困的人从窗户里向进攻者开火。

sentences.english: On the Dragon’s stub-wings the 40mm ROCKET LAUNCHERS open up with a BARRAGE of leaping fire which FLASHES down and
sentences.chinese: 飞龙战机的短翼上，40毫米火箭发射器一齐开火。

sentences.english: She thought that some of them had been laying violent hands on me; and, not daring to attack her master, she turned her vocal artillery against the young scoundrel.
sentences.chinese: 她不敢攻击她的主人，就向那年轻的恶棍开火了。

sentences.english: Buzzers were later used at all the guns to give the signal for firing.
sentences.chinese: 后来就给各炮安装下达开火令的响铃。

sentences.english: The angry Stuyvesant went to Fort Amsterdam and prepared to open fire on the British.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的司徒维桑特走到阿姆斯特丹堡准备向英方开火。

sentences.english: They were firing large guns at the green warriors.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在用巨大的枪朝绿色的武士们开火。

sentences.english: The troops opened fire on workers and killed dozens.
sentences.chinese: 军队在工人上开火，四死伤无数。

sentences.english: Synchro Cannons on line and ready to fire.
sentences.chinese: 同步炮连接能源，准备开火。

sentences.english: We shot them out of their hiding places.
sentences.chinese: 隐蔽的地方开火逼他们走出来。

sentences.english: Bahraini security forces later opened fire on the funeral proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 随后，巴林警方在葬礼上开火。

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
